name: Curacao Marriott Beach Resort & Emerald Casino

reviews.title: Wonderful visit
reviews.text: (note - this was posted in the Curacao forum)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family just returned from a week at the Marriott Curacao - we had a great time. The hotel was good - typical Marriott rooms, good, comfortable in island colors - and the restaurants were fine. Our boys are 16 and 13 and active. We dove most everyday and they made good use of the watersports at the dive shop. I thought the dive shop was very, very good - good equipment, emphasis on safety, super people and good prices if you are in the market for equipment. Can't say enough good things about the people at the dive shop: especially Sadie, Oliver as divemasters, Sandra inside and JJ and Freddy who took the boys tubing, kneeboarding and wakeboarding (they don't call JJ "the punisher" for nothing).
reviews.title: I'm DEFINITELY going back!

likes.disliked: — the food at the emeral lounge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rented a car for one day and that was more than enough for the boys. The island is small, not pretty and not much in the way of interesting things for our boys. We did see Boca Tabla and Pistol which was interesting and stopped at a nice beach for lunch; not much in the way of watersports at other beaches. The boys asked not to tour around anymore. Some folks with little kids said the ostriches and dolphins were good.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Hook's Hut twice; the second time to make sure our first experience was not as poor as we thought, especially after all of the raves we had read. The first time my fish was undercooked and my son's burger had a funny taste; we mentioned it to the waitress (not a complaint or request for refund, just a mention) and the manager (I assume), x-dutch guy, came over and said he and the chef had tasted the burger, thought it was ok so what was our complaint! Our second visit was better - call it fairly good food (fish was right to slightly undercooked but I appreciate that as overcooked fish is easy but not good). Liked being on the beach better than inside. We ate at Govenors Mansion which was good, ask for the gallery tables (res. sugg.) Tried to get to Mambo's but it was too hard to break away from the beach. Therefore, ate mostly at the hotel: Portofino was better than we expected; the cerviche and bouillabase at the Emerald Seafood lounge were very good and you can get these at any of the restaurants, including the Seabreeze beach bar (otherwise Seabreeze was a burger and sandwich place); the third restaurant was closed for renovations. Taxis for getting around at night are expensive; $25-40 to get to Wilemstad and restaurants (depending on which side of the inlet) and the same coming back.
reviews.title: Curacao - as delightful the second time around 4/14-4/21/07

likes.liked: — The easy access to beach and central location on the island.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would we come here again? Yes! After 4 days our answer was no simply because there is not much else on the island of interest to us and the restaurants at night were expensive to get to. However, we soon found that it was so easy at the Marriott with the diving, snorkeling, water sports and with being so well taken care of that we really relaxed; next time we will add 4 days to the trip. What would we do differently? Believe it or not, rent a car for the week, if we could do so for under $300/wk; very easy to get around and, mentally, a 'better' spend than on taxis. A car would enable us to easily get into Wilemstad for dining whenever we wanted as well as to go out two days to beaches and bring dive gear from the hotel. Hotels? Yep - stay here, they did us right. The Hilton next door looked run down; didn't see any others. We liked this better than Cancun, Jamaica and G. Cayman (though my wife liked the Ritz best). Diving was better than Cancun, St Thomas and St Kitts, about equal to Cayman but not as good as Cozumel (the wall is fantastic). People nicer than anywhere else.
reviews.title: Loved the Charm of the Hotel, Employees, Locals, Island and Perfect Weather

likes.liked: — Great Service, Great People, Very Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My other half and I stayed here for a week in June on points with the all-inclusive package. We were upgraded on arrival to one of the ground floor, oceanfront rooms. It had great views and was only a few steps from the beach. Though the room was certainly a bit dated, which we expected from the reviews, it was otherwise large and clean. Who spends that much time in the room when they are in a beautiful place like Curacao anyway!
reviews.title: Relaxing beach vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rest of the hotel did not disappoint either. The pool is large with a fun swim-up bar, the beach is extremely pretty with some top-notch snorkeling when it is clear (though we were there when there was still some oil in the water that often got on us.. ick) and the staff were friendly. There were definitely too few palapas on the beach (so get out there early if you want one), but they were building more while we were there. The restaurants were more than edible, with enough variety to keep us from getting bored for a week. I agree with others that Portofino is probably not worth it for dinner if you don't have the AI, but then again, I would definitely recommend the AI if you will be eating and drinking at the hotel. The drinks alone can add up quickly.
reviews.title: Good Resort, Very Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We did not rent a car, but we did venture in to town on the hotel shuttle (make sure to reserve ahead), which was definitely worth a few hours. We also took some side trips, including one of the afternoon snorkeling excursions from the on-site dive shop. We got an awfully choppy day, and while it did not bother the divers, it made the snorkelers quite sea-sick since we were dropped off in the same open water as the divers. If you plan on doing that trip as a snorkeler, check out how rough the water is that day if you are going out with divers because it can end up being less than enjoyable, despite the friendly crew.
reviews.title: We Loved it for a 2nd time with family.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel for a pretty, relaxing beach vacation!
reviews.title: It was OK but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a seven day vacation to Curacao over Thanksgiving last year. We stayed on the All-inclusive package at the resort, which if you can get it for the right price, I highly recommend, as food and drink can really add up. I think we paid somewhere around $300 per night for te package, which included alcoholic beverages and all food for 2 adults and 2 kids (under 12), I think the regular rate was about $149 per night during that period, and on the islands, food and drink is easily over $75 per day per person and that's if your kind of skimping it, so I can't stress if you can get a deal on the all inclusive go for it, the only thing you'll regret is the 10 lbs of steack and lobster that you'll pack on during the trip.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, convenient location
Very happy with our choice
reviews.text: Nice property and nice beachfron (much better than any other hotel we saw)t. Front desk people were very helpful - specifically Kurt. Kurt upgraded us and put us just a few steps from the beach. He genuinely cared about our stay and recognized us when we passed through the lobby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We've snorkled less than five time, but enjoyed the ease of renting equipment next to the hotel. The reef in front of the hotel was nice for us amateurs and we felt very safe. Saw some great fish and were shocked when a 7-8 foot ray swam right buy us.
reviews.title: CURACAO MARRIOTT IS NOT A PET FRIENDLY HOTEL!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool scene was fine and enjoyed the booze shack on the beach. Saw some great sunsets from our location.
reviews.title: Good Hotel But Needs More of the Marriott Touch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only true negative was the service at the bar in the lobby. ANNOYING SLOW and it was not even busy.
reviews.title: marriott definately the right choice paradise at your feet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I would definitely return. Say "hey" to Kurt.
reviews.title: 3rd time@the Mariott: we love this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we just returned and our initial impression was that it is a beautiful hotel. But the rooms (we had oceanview but were promised at arrival that we had oceanFRONT) are typical hotel rooms with a VERY small balcony unless you book a corner Oceanfront suite. Nice Turndown Service at night , and Bath and Bodyworks bath amenties...The ocean is very rocky except in one place near the seawall - but the water in that area was so strewn with candy wrappers and plastic bags that I did not want to swim there, We went to the pool at around 4:30 but it was so crowded (probably due to "Happy Hour" at the swim up bar) that we kept getting hit with balls that kids were throwing. The spa did not have an opening for a pedicure for the next 3 days, and the beauty salon doesn't open until 2:00 on Saturdays. If you wear nail polish, bring it. We could not find one shop in that area that sells it (I even checked the other resorts' shops - You have to take a $12.00 taxi to town if you need to buy any). One plus is that car rental counters are there in the lobby. The taxi to the airport is $20.00 one way - no hotel shuttle. When I asked about departure tax at the airport I was given 3 different answers (No one except the manager knew that AA' s tickets already include this). Hotel staff was pleasant except for the woman at check-in who actually yelled at me and argued because i charged a meal to our room before she gave us the key. (I had already given her my credit card, signed the paperwork and was given the room number) - The manager was great - fixed this situation immediately and did not charge us for the upgrade to oceanview. Loved the buffet breakfast and dinner at the resort's Portofino restaurant. - Looked like a great place for kids...
reviews.title: Curacao Marriott Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Curacao Marriott was just what we needed. We were looking for a restful getaway. The rooms are nothing special, but we spent little time in ours. We did enjoy our view of the beach and small balcony. The hotel itself is very pretty and the staff is friendly and helpful. Since the Palm Cafe was closed, all breakfasts were served at Portofino. Loved watching the birds snatch sugar packets from the tables. The beach was a bit rocky, but there are areas that are smooth and you can easily walk out into the water. Snorkeling along the manmade reef was actually pretty nice. Lots of fish and you barely have to go anywhere. The beach bar (The Board Room) was a welcome relief from the hot sun. Kept us cool and "well hydrated". If you like fresh fish, try the whole snapper. You can order from Seabreeze or The Emerald Lounge and they'll bring it down to the beach. Sunsets are lovely through the palm trees. Stop by the deli for pate and cheeses and hit the beach with a glass of wine. The beach was a tad "trashy" now and then. Even though it was raked daily, it often needed a bit more. Grab a grass hut early, if you need to get out of the sun. The pool is always welcoming. Swim up bar perfect for happy hour out of the sun.
reviews.title: Relaxing getaway. Warm and friendly.

likes.liked: — great setting: view of Caribbean through palm trees
likes.disliked: — ordinary room: little character, very basic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was good. A step above "hotel" food. Even the Island BBQ at Seabreeze one night was very good. Dinners at Portofino are even better if you get to enjoy then outside. Going into town was a quick "been there, done that" trip. Not much to see. My favorite part was the floating footbridge that separates the two sides of Willemstad. Oh, and the Amstel Bright at a cafe along the water. Relax and enjoy.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott for our honeymoon. I must let everyone know I've worked in the hotel industry for over 10 years so I am very particular about hotels. I am the kind of person who pulls back bed sheets to check for hair and scopes the bathroom for dirt and soap scum. With this in mind the Curacao Marriott exceeded my expectations! Here are our pros and cons:
reviews.title: NO- NO- NO- Don't Stay Here!!! NOT 5 STAR!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2003, traveled with family
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Best Christmas ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed at the Marriott in Curacao this past week for 7 nights. It was our family's third time in Curacao, first at the Marriott. From the waiters to the general manager and everyone in between, the level of service was top-notch. All the resort's employees greeted us with a smile and were always at the "ready" to serve or help with any of our needs. A special thank you to the manager NAZEERA who showed much professionalism when handling a concern we had.
reviews.title: No Problems Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food was fine at the resort as was the entertainment at night. Yes, the rooms are a bit dated but our beachfront room offered no problems. The water provided great snorkeling right at the resort. Once again, the cost of breakfast, luch, and dinner can add up quickly along with the cost for taxis, However, that is the trade-off for almost always guaranteed good weather in Curacao and a good time.
reviews.title: Not a bad experience for the price- RENT A CAR FOR OTHER BEACHES!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Hato Caves/ Ostrich Farm trip and the Sea Aquarium provided 2 days worth of
reviews.title: Beautiful views, great bar drinks, food service could use a kick in the pants.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: good times as well as shopping in town. I would like to thank everyone at the Marriott and I actually did before I left for a nice vacation. I would definitely return to the Marriott the next time I go to Curacao. The Marriott in St. Kitts was nice too but it was the people working at the Curacao resort that made this trip stand out.
reviews.title: Amazing veiws and snorkeling!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: My family spent 7 nights at this hotel (7/9-7/16) after having been here some years ago in 1998 (the hotel was under a different name). The grounds and buildings are well maintained and clean, although the rooms are a bit dated. There was a slightly musty room odor- no doubt due to the presence of carpets (nto sure why most hotels insist on installing carpets in humid, tropical locations anyway). Check in was no problem- the staff was efficient and pleasant. Nice lobby too.
reviews.title: Not worth the money, I wouldn't go back even if it was free.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from our week long stay at Curacao’s Marriott Beach Resort. A wonderful place!! We could not have been happier on our trip. The Marriott was one of the best places we have ever stayed. Literally right on a beautiful beach, there are plenty of things to see and do here. They have lots of free activities at the hotel, including an iguana feeding in the afternoon which was a real treat. If you want to stray from the hotel’s atmosphere, there is a tour desk that has a huge variety of tours you can go on that start right from the hotel. There is also a National/Alamo car rental desk in the lobby. We opted to rent a car and to do a full island tour from the tour desk. The tour was extremely fun and informative. We drove into town to go shopping one day and that as interesting. It was really hard to find parking. That was really the only complaint I had about that.
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to do the all inclusive plan at the Marriott which was really the way to go. They have great restaurants to choose from and good food. We mostly ate at the Seabreez which we thought was really good. The atmosphere of this restaurant was so fun! Its right by the pool, plus the have a deck that is right on the beach. Very romantic for dinner at night. One night we even saw a sting ray gliding through the water! The all inclusive also includes all non-motorized water sports so we kayaked and snorkeled quite a bit which was great! As for having to save chairs on the beach and by the pool, we never had a problem with this at all. Not once did we have to go down and reserve ourselves chairs.
reviews.title: Best vacation!
1st Rate Customer Service at the Marriott
reviews.text: The people of this island are so down to earth and friendly! I just love them. All of the employees at the Marriott were friendly and helpful. Every single employee that we encountered said hello to us, even if we were just passing by them.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all our experience on this island and at the Marriott were absolutely wonderful. In my opinion, this is one of the best islands to visit. It is so full of culture and history and has wonderful things to see and do. We will definitely be going back and staying at the Marriott!
reviews.title: Awesome stay. Need to return

likes.liked: — clean and attention to needs and wants

reviews.title: We Loved It!
reviews.text: I have been to many islands and I must say Curacao was fantastic!! We

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here from 5/14-5/20/11. We arrived at night to find the grounds nicely lit and a welcoming and easy check in process. Then, we took a stroll down to the beach, put our feet in the water and sat in the sand. It was dark so we really couldnt see much. Then we go back to our room and discover we are covered in giant globs of oil! We then asked management and only then did they inform us that the beach has been closed for days due to oil. Not too sure why no one told us sooner! It took a good 30-45 minutes of scrubbing to get it all off. The beach remained closed for the remainder of our stay.
reviews.title: Hotel was nice but Beach was Closed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was very pretty. The beach looked nice if you could actually use it. The reef is right offshore so there is excellent snorkeling access.
reviews.title: Needs a coat of paint and a major overhaul of the service department.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I would recommend.
reviews.title: Great Location, Pool and Private Beach but Food is Terrible!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a shame that no one could have mentioned the oil spill at check-in before we became coated in oil.
reviews.title: Relaxing and Fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just got back from our honeymoon where we stayed at the Marriott for a week. When we arrived we were thrilled with the beautiful lobby. The check-in process was quick and easy, the girl at the front desk was very nice and we got to pick from several complimentary options for being elite members. We selected wine and cheese, and they asked when we would like it delivered. We asked for 4 pm. The elevator was down in our wing, so a bell boy helped us carry our bags up to the room. On the walk to the room it seemed as though the hallways could use a fresh coat of paint. The furniture in our room was pretty dinged up, but the view was beautiful and we had a small balcony with chairs and a table. There was no fridge in the room. There was also no amenities book so we had no idea where the ice machine was. We called to ask where it was and they offered to bring up some ice instead of telling us where the machine was.
reviews.title: Great Hotel...still a TINY amount of oil in water.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I honeymooned here and just LOVED it. We were there for 10 days and did not have one complaint. Everything was just wonderful and we couldn't have asked for anything more. We ate some of the best food we have ever eaten at this resort. The staff was amazing too. We got to know the bartenders at the swim ip bar well and just had SO much fun with them. If you go here, I would definitely recomend renting a car for the day and exploring the island beacause it is beautiful. This is the only day we left the resort and it was awesome! There are a ton of "hidden" beaches down the coast. There are little signs and you pull off the road and go to the water and you will just see some of the most beautiful sights you have ever seen. I would definitly recomend going to Big Knip. Ask any of the staff at the hotel how to get there. It is the most amazing beach in the world. We went and there were only 5 other people there and it was like we were in heaven...I can't even describe the beauty. Ok so if you haven't gotten it yet, GO HERE!!! You will have the best time ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: WONDERFUL - Stay here - no complaints at ALL!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the Marriott Curacao for our 20th anniversary trip and we were very pleased with our stay! Upon our arrival in our room, we were sent a bottle of champagne for our anniversary along with a wonderful dessert! The staff was so friendly and worked with us the next day to upgrade to a beachfront room, which was fabulous, perfect for sunset watching and listening to the water on the beach. When you first arrive you have to give yourself time to switch to 'Caribbean time'!
reviews.title: Relaxing Anniversary Trip to Curacao Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room was basic, yes, but decorated nicely in blues and yellows. The main attraction is what is outside, so that was fine. The balcony is small, but easily fits two! We spent most of our stay in Curacao at the resort, but did venture out to Willemstad one morning. The shuttle is very convenient, leaving at 9 and picking up noon. That time was sufficient to walk through both sides of the city, although I would recommend a tour, if possible, to get more information on the history of the city.
reviews.title: The ONLY place to stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach at the Marriott is very nice, and we did bring water shoes as recommended, but didn't use them. Go into the water on the right side of the beach to avoid the rocky part. There is a lot of wind in Curacao, especially earlier in the day, and this probably caused the beach to have some trash around, which would have been nice to have been picked up. We loved the beachside bar, the Board Room, for drinks and lunches. The pool is very attractive, with lots of shade as needed, and a swim up bar with a 4.30 happy hour. Snorkeling was great as well! In and around the rocky reefs we saw lots of colorful fish. We went in on the opposite side of the beach where the watersport hut is, and swam around the rocks back to the main beach side. You can actually see the fish by just standing in the water! Bring your own snorkeling gear, or rent by the pool.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous
Excellent Hotel & Staff
reviews.text: We enjoyed the food at the Marriott. The buffet breakfast at Portofino was quite good, with omelettes made by Jacqueline daily! We sat outside and had wonderful coffee, enjoyed the occasional light raindrops and watching the birds. As mentioned, our lunches were at the Boardroom for something light. We purchased wine and cheese at Voila! for our sunset parties. For dinner, we dined at Seabreeze, once for the All American BBQ buffet, which I must say was surprisingly good, and we dined at Portofino twice. Try the salmon w/ risotto, very delicious. We dined at Sjallotte (at Floris Suites) one night, across the street from the Marriott and had a fabulous meal there. We had a chef's menu, where he selected each course and the wine for us. It was amazing!

aka: Curacao Marriott Beach Resort And Emerald Casino
description: The Curacao Marriott Beach Resort & Emerald Bay Casino are located directly on a private beach in Willemstad, Curacao. Spend your days basking in the sun at our resort pool or beach, or experiencing all history and adventure Curacao has to offer through our on site Tour and Car Rental desk. Once the sunsets, you will experience amazing dining by sea at our beachfront restaurant Seabreeze.
